item.title: UK travel update: Overhaul of 'traffic light' rules expected
item.description: Ministers are expected to announce changes to the travel traffic light system in England on Friday.

item.title: Police must prioritise tackling violence on women
item.description: Reducing violence against women should have the same priority as countering terrorism, a watchdog says.

item.title: 'It's still sinking in!' - Raducanu on winning the US Open
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu tells BBC Breakfast about the "whirlwind" experience of winning the US Open.

item.title: Reshuffle: Boris Johnson's new cabinet meets for first time
item.description: The PM gives his new line-up of ministers a "half-time pep talk", after this week's reshuffle.

item.title: Aukus: US and UK face international backlash over Australia defence deal
item.description: The nuclear submarine deal with Australia has angered France and raised fears of a war with China.

item.title: Prince Andrew may challenge High Court ruling on US case
item.description: Virginia Giuffre is pursuing a civil case in New York against the prince over allegations of sexual assault.

item.title: GB News: I became a minority of one, says Andrew Neil
item.description: The ex-BBC presenter who quit the channel says people can decide themselves if it is too right wing.

item.title: California fires: General Sherman and other sequoias given blankets
item.description: Fire-resistant blankets protect General Sherman and other sequoias as a California blaze closes in.

item.title: House-building reforms paused amid Conservative MP anger
item.description: Newly appointed Housing Secretary Michael Gove wants to address concerns, the BBC has been told.

item.title: Long Covid less common than feared - ONS study
item.description: One in 40 people has some long-lasting symptoms, Office for National Statistics data suggests.

item.title: The Wanted's Tom Parker: 'I'm not paying attention to cancer'
item.description: "The more you pay attention to it, the more the cancer has control of you," says The Wanted star.

item.title: Emmerdale: Actress Elizabeth Estensen leaving ITV soap after 22 years
item.description: Elizabeth Estensen, who played landlady Diane Sugden, says it is time to "say goodbye".

item.title: The Papers: Double-jabbed 'holiday joy' and defence pact challenged
item.description: Changes to travel test rules and the fallout from the UK's submarine pact are among the front-page stories.

item.title: FA Cup: Prof Jonathan Van-Tam on his 50-year love affair with Boston United
item.description: As Boston United prepare for the FA Cup this weekend, superfan Prof Jonathan Van-Tam talks selfies, vaccinating his heroes, and turning his house into a Pilgrims shrine.

item.title: How TikTokers took down a Texas anti-abortion site
item.description: A draconian abortion ban in Texas has Gen Z fighting its enforcement through hacktivism

item.title: Winning photographers capture Britain's maritime heritage
item.description: The winning images from this year's Shipwrecked Mariners' Society photography competition.

item.title: Education in prison: 'If I can do it, anyone can’
item.description: Two prisoners describe how their education inside took them on a different path.

item.title: Sara Pascoe revealed as new Great British Sewing Bee host
item.description: The comic and writer is taking over from Joe Lycett, who has hosted the last three series.

item.title: Afghan refugee: Being caught by Taliban 'was like a scary movie'
item.description: Refugee Marwa Koofi and her family were captured at Kabul airport

item.title: Emma Raducanu reunited with her parents in Bromley
item.description: Emma Raducanu is photographed with father Ian after becoming Britain's youngest Grand Slam champion.

item.title: The big problem of building waste and how to tackle it
item.description: How better technology and regulation could cut the waste generated by the construction industry.

item.title: Sir Clive Sinclair: Tireless inventor ahead of his time
item.description: The prolific innovator invented the pocket calculator and the ill-fated Sinclair C5 electric car.

item.title: Lil Nas X: Is the rapper the defining star of his generation?
item.description: The rapper has subverted hip-hop with his LGBT-positive lyrics, while dominating critics on social media.

item.title: Michael Gove: What will he do with beefed-up planning and levelling up job?
item.description: Michael Gove is known as a reformer and is now in charge of controversial planning changes.

item.title: Oasis Knebworth 1996: 'We had no fear'
item.description: Noel Gallagher on the new film marking 25 years since his old band's era-defining gigs.

item.title: Liberal Democrats: Is Ed Davey sticking to his promises?
item.description: We look at the performance of the party and its leader as the Lib Dem conference gets going.

item.title: Jamie Campbell: We need more stories from outside London
item.description: A new film tells the story of a boy who lives on a council estate and is obsessed with drag.

item.title: Gen Z battles to bring back unions, one Starbucks at a time
item.description: Younger Americans are reviving US labour activism amid stagnant wages and Covid hardship.

item.title: Canada federal election: The man who could topple Trudeau
item.description: The new Conservative leader has tied Justin Trudeau in the polls with a pitch to moderate voters.

item.title: Party political conferences: What to expect this year
item.description: Our guide to what conferences are, when and where they're taking place, and what's likely to happen.

item.title: New Zealand men abandon Pakistan tour after 'government security alert'
item.description: New Zealand men's team abandon their limited-overs tour of Pakistan following a New Zealand government "security alert".

item.title: 'It almost feels like it's not me playing' - Raducanu on watching US Open final for first time
item.description: US Open champion Emma Raducanu says it felt like somebody else was playing as she watched Saturday's final for the first time on returning home.

item.title: Jon Rahm: European Ryder Cup star improving after stomach problems
item.description: World number one Jon Rahm says he is feeling "OK" after a suffering a stomach ailment as he prepares for next week's Ryder Cup at a PGA Tour event in California.

item.title: England v New Zealand: Heather Knight stars as hosts win ODI opener in Bristol
item.description: England overcome a stuttering batting performance to beat New Zealand by 30 runs in a close first one-day international in Bristol.

item.title: Washington Football Team beat the New York Giants after Darius Slayton drop
item.description: The Washington Football Team beat the New York Giants with help from a terrible drop from Darius Slayton in the opening game of week two in the NFL.

item.title: Brighton & Hove Albion's Yves Bissouma: I'm best midfielder in Premier League
item.description: Brighton's Yves Bissouma says he believes he is the best midfielder in the Premier League before the Seagulls' game against Leicester on Sunday.

item.title: What are the travel rules now?
item.description: A traffic light system is in place setting out rules for entering the UK

item.title: Covid rules: What's in England's 'Winter Plan'?
item.description: Lockdown rules have changed across the UK, but some restrictions remain in place.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings?
item.description: Face coverings could become a legal requirement in England again if the NHS struggles this winter.

item.title: Flu jab 2021: Who’s eligible for a free vaccine?
item.description: This year's roll out has expanded in an attempt to shield against a double whammy of flu and Covid.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Is it safe to vaccinate our child? And other questions
item.description: We answer some of your questions about vaccinating 12-15 year-olds, the booster vaccine and other topics.

item.title: Hushpuppi - the Instagram influencer and international fraudster
item.description: How Nigerian Ramon Abbas went from a romance scammer to a so-called "Billionaire Gucci Master".

item.title: ‘Havana syndrome ’ and the mystery of the microwaves
item.description: The BBC investigates a mystery illness dubbed "Havana syndrome" that has affected American diplomats and spies.

item.title: 'The near-death experience that made me a top musician'
item.description: When Tony Kofi had a near-fatal accident, he had a vision of himself playing a musical instrument. It would change his life forever.

item.title: Chaos and confusion: The frenzied final hours of the Afghan government
item.description: Through interviews with insiders, BBC News has pieced together an account of how Afghanistan’s government unravelled.

item.title: 'I studied law in jail - now I want to change the system'
item.description: LaTonya Myers spent nine months in jail because she couldn’t afford bail - now she's helping others facing the same challenge.
